intro: Ornithogalum busambarense, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients for growth. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum busambarense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in gardens.
